title: [Large-Scale] Iterative Learning Control (ILC) Simulation Education for Periodic Noise Removal in Language Processing Systems

context.prior_knowledge: Basic control system theory, understanding of feedback control principles, and foundational knowledge of language processing systems
context.additional_context: Practical training for administrators on removing periodic noise in speech recognition and natural language processing systems. Trainees learn to optimize system performance using language data analysis and signal processing techniques.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze characteristics of periodic disturbances in audio/text data and conduct repeated experiments (3+ times) using simulation tools.
Learners can design a reference signal that reduces measurement errors in language processing systems by 30% or more using the ILC algorithm.
Learners can verbally explain step-by-step processes of eliminating periodic disturbances in feedback control systems in a VR environment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
